intro: Seseli macrophyllum, commonly known as the large-leaved seseli, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes familiar plants like carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and along streambanks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
